title: Herqulez
subtitle: Modular Fitness Ecosystem Platform
projectType: Marketing Website for Health Tech Startup

overview.challenge: Herqulez is a modular fitness platform covering six areas - Core Fitness, Nutrition, Sleep/Recovery, Habits, Sport, and Travel - each with its own product identity. The marketing website needed to communicate a complex, multi-module ecosystem clearly without overwhelming visitors, while establishing trust ahead of the app launch.
overview.solution: We designed and built a high-performance marketing website with Nuxt 4 that introduces the Herqulez ecosystem in a clear, visually engaging way. The architecture prioritizes performance and SEO, with multi-language support (English and Danish live, with more planned) and a GDPR-compliant analytics setup via GTM consent-mode.
overview.outcome: The marketing site achieved Lighthouse scores of 99 (Performance), 93 (Accessibility), 96 (Best Practices), and 100 (SEO). It positions Herqulez for the planned MVP launch in early 2026, with a scalable foundation ready for additional languages and content.

keyMetrics.label: Languages
keyMetrics.description: English and Danish, with German, Spanish, French, and Swedish planned

process.description: We worked closely with the Herqulez founders to understand the product roadmap, target audience, and go-to-market strategy. Key priorities were clear communication of the modular concept, brand credibility ahead of launch, and a scalable multi-language architecture.

We designed a high-contrast, energy-forward visual identity for the website that aligns with the Herqulez app design system. The layout guides visitors from brand introduction through module overviews to a clear call to action, keeping the complex ecosystem approachable.

We built the site with Nuxt 4 and configured it for static site generation, delivering fast load times without ongoing server costs. Comprehensive Schema.org markup, canonical tags, and page-level meta content were implemented. GTM with consent-mode ensures compliant analytics from launch.

challenges.title: Communicating Ecosystem Complexity
challenges.problem: Presenting six interconnected fitness modules without overwhelming visitors who may only be interested in one area.
challenges.solution: We structured the site to lead with the overarching value proposition, then progressively introduce each module. Clear visual separation and focused copy keep the experience navigable.

challenges.title: Pre-launch Credibility
challenges.problem: The app is not yet launched, so the website needs to build trust and capture early interest without a live product to show.
challenges.solution: We focused on clear messaging, strong brand visuals, Lighthouse-verified performance, and a credible product story grounded in the validation work the founders had already done.

results.summary: The Herqulez marketing website launched with near-perfect technical scores and a clear, confident brand presence. It is positioned to support the app launch in early 2026 and built to scale with additional languages and content sections as the product grows.
highlights: Lighthouse: 99 Performance, 93 Accessibility, 96 Best Practices, 100 SEO
English and Danish live at launch
Static Nuxt 4 build with CDN delivery for minimal hosting cost
Schema.org markup for rich search results
Ready for German, Spanish, French, and Swedish expansion

learnings: A well-structured marketing site can establish credibility for a product that has not yet launched, if the brand story is clear
Multi-language architecture is best planned from the start - retrofitting it later is significantly more work
Static site generation delivers excellent performance with minimal infrastructure cost for marketing sites
Consent-mode analytics setup from day one means compliant data collection as soon as visitors arrive
nextSteps: Update the site with app screenshots as the MVP approaches launch
Expand language support to German, Spanish, French, and Swedish
Add a blog or insight section to support SEO growth
Integrate a waitlist or early-access signup once the product is ready
